intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subsp. caricinum, commonly known as the mountain thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and often edible plants. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal practices.
